wikipedia_page.main: Michael Carr (born 31 January 1946) is a British teacher, lecturer, and politician for the Liberal Democrats. Originally a teacher, Carr became active in politics as a Conservative councillor before joining the Social Democratic Party. After two unsuccessful general election candidacies, Carr won a sensational by-election victory in 1991 to become the Member of Parliament (MP) for Ribble Valley. His victory was short-lived as he lost the seat in the general election that followed a year later, and he twice failed to regain it.

response: As part of the Ribble Valley constituency, Clitheroe has been represented by a Conservative Member of Parliament for many years, with the exception of Michael Carr, who won a by-election in 1991 for the Liberal Democrats, but who lost the seat at the general election which followed a year later.
*Michael Carr (English footballer) (born 1983), currently playing for Stalybridge Celtic
*Michael Carr (Labour politician) (1947–1990), British politician, MP for Bootle in 1990
*Michael Carr (Liberal Democrat politician) (born 1946), British politician, MP for Ribble Valley 1991–92
*Michael Carr, presenter of Faces of Death

The Ribble Valley by-election, in Lancashire, England, took place on 7 March 1991 following the elevation of MP David Waddington to the House of Lords. Michael Carr of the Liberal Democrats won election at his third attempt.
* Michael Carr, Liberal Democrat MP for Ribble Valley 1991–92.The Times Guide to the House of Commons 1983, revised and updated edition, Times Books, 1984, p. 191.
